description: Triangle in which j-th entry in i-th row is (i+1-j)^j, 0<=j<=i.
references: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 24.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of triangle, flattened
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
formula: T(n,0) = 1; T(n,k) = (n-k+1)*T(n-1,k-1) for k=1..n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 02 2014
maple: A009999 := proc(i,j) (i+1-j)^j ; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 16 2011
prog: (Haskell)a009999 n k = (n + 1 - k) ^ ka009999_row n = a009999_tabl !! na009999_tabl = [1] : map snd (iterate f ([1,1], [1,1])) where   f (us@(u:_), vs) = (us', 1 : zipWith (*) us' vs)                      where us' = (u + 1) : us-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 02 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
